Definition at line 1070 of file mmwavelink.h.

rlInt32_t(* rlOsiMutexCbs_t::rlOsiMutexLock)(rlOsiMutexHdl_t *mutexHdl, rlOsiTime_t timeout)

Lock Mutex Object.

Parameters
[in]mutexHdl- Pointer to Mutex object
[in]timeout- Maximum Time to wait for Mutex Lock
Returns
rlInt32_t Success - 0, Failure - Error code

OSI Lock Mutex Object. mmWaveLink requires this Mutex object to be locked to avoid any parallel API call for the same device instance. In one of the case when mmWaveLink is underway for a command-response and device sends Async-event message in between, so at this instance mmWaveLink will try to lock the same Mutex again. Expectation is that command-response sequence should complete first and that flow unlocks this Mutex and then only at other context mmWaveLink will cater the Async-event (HostIrq) request. mmWaveLink passes timeout as max value, where it expects to lock the Mutex for max period. Any non-zero return value will be treated as error and mmWaveLink will generate async-event message [SBID RL_RET_CODE_RADAR_OSIF_ERROR] with payload of error code (-10). This error async-event will be generated only in the interrupt context while catering any AWR device's async-event message whereas during the CMD-RSP flow that API will return with error code (-10).

Definition at line 1043 of file mmwavelink.h.

rlInt32_t(* rlOsiMutexCbs_t::rlOsiMutexUnLock)(rlOsiMutexHdl_t *mutexHdl)

Unlock Mutex Object.

Parameters
[in]mutexHdl- Pointer to Mutex object
Returns
rlInt32_t Success - 0, Failure - Error code

Unlock Mutex Object. Any non-zero return value will be treated as error and mmWaveLink will return its own error code (-10).
